actions.action: Propose gump as an Apache top level project.
Keep project metadata clean/healthy, keep re-use strong.
Get more Gump hosts (for more cycles, smaller time windows).
Ensure the subtle differences of Python Gump are correctly noted.
Make it easier for folks to install/get started with local/private Gumps.
Make distributed management easier (e.g. manually, for legal reasons, rsynch packages from central repository.)
Allow cascading Gumps, that 'download' jars from each other to save cycles & increase "reach" to a wider community.
Mail gump@jakarta.apache.org with feedback on usability (of the outputs, or providing the metadata).
Identify 'prebuilt' projects (visually, and in lists like 'Packages').
Allow Cascading Gumps (downloading JARs via Ruper)
Add 'server' entries, see mailing list for proposal...
Add more interfaces to source control, and clean up the XML metadata to be SCM agnostic.
Historical database (probably RDBMS, not just a simple DBM like now).
